info.name: Job Board API
info.description:
### API Documentation

Postman Collection

We have created an online Postman collection to help you easily test all the API endpoints. You can import the Postman collection using the following link:

[Postman Collection Link](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/12381022/2sB2ixjtYb)

##### How to Use the Postman Collection

1. **Import the Collection**:
    
    - Open the Postman application.
        
    - Click the "Import" button in the top left corner.
        
    - Select the "Link" tab.
        
    - CopyInsert\[[https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/12381022/2sB2ixjtYb](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/12381022/2sB2ixjtYb)\]([https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/12381022/2sB2ixjtYb](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/12381022/2sB2ixjtYb))
        
2. **Browse Endpoints**:
    
    - After importing, the collection will appear in the sidebar under the specified collection name.
        
    - Click on the collection name to expand and view all available endpoints.
        
3. **Set Up Environment**:
    
    - You might need to set up an environment with variables like `base_url`.
        
    - Click on "Environments" in the left sidebar, then "Add" to create a new environment.
        
    - Add a new variable named `base_url` and set its value to `http://localhost:8000/api` or your server address.
        
    - Select the environment you created from the dropdown in the top right corner.
        
4. **Make Requests**:
    
    - Click on any endpoint within the collection.
        
    - Modify the parameters as needed in the central section.
        
    - Click the "Send" button to make the request and view the response.
        
5. **Edit Requests**:
    
    - You can edit any request to suit your needs.
        
    - Use tabs like "Params", "Headers", and "Body" to customize the request.
        

##### Examples of Using Endpoints

- **GET /api/jobs**:
    
    - Description: Returns a list of jobs with optional filtering.
        
    - Usage: Select the `GET /api/jobs` endpoint, add any filter parameters if needed, and click "Send".
        

##### Tips

- **Customize Requests**: You can modify any request to meet your specific needs, such as changing filter parameters or modifying request data.
    
- **Save Responses**: You can save responses for later use or to compare results.
    
- **Security Settings**: If you need to set up security like tokens, you can add them in the "Headers" tab.
    

This way, users can easily import and use the Postman collection to test your API.

EndFragment
